letters.description: Identify the specific emotional trigger, physical sensation, or traumatic memory to be addressed.
Measure the initial intensity of the distress using the Subjective Units of Distress (SUDs) scale.
Apply the tapping sequence on meridian points while maintaining focus on the identified issue.
Introduce cognitive reframing and positive affirmations once the emotional charge has decreased.
Harmonize the new cognitive shift with the body's nervous system to ensure lasting change.
Scan for any remaining somatic tension or secondary emotional layers and clear them.
Anchor the feeling of relief and emotional freedom into the client's current physiological state.
